p: Mesenchymal stem cells have long been known to regulate the cellular immune system. They suppress effector T cells through production of interleukin‐10, transforming growth factor‐α, inducible nitric oxide synthase, heme oxygenase‐1, prostaglandin E2, and indolamine 2,3‐dioxgenase and generation and differentiation of dendritic cells 6. They are thought to shift immune response toward anti‐inflammatory, tolerogenic phenotype (a shift from T helper type 1 to T helper type 2 immune response) as reviewed by Kode et al. 7.
